availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Bart County, North Carolina, native. Son of Blake Baker and Christie Baker. Married to Edna Gresham Baker in Trigg County, Kentucky, on July 22, 1822. Father of Leander Baker, Christian F. Baker, Laurinda Baker, Hazard P. Baker, Blake Baker, Thomas K. Baker, Helen E. Baker, Linn B. Baker, Mary E. Baker, and John F. Baker. Farmer in Trigg County in 1830. Owned five enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1830. Farmer in Trigg County in 1840. Owned one enslaved person in Trigg County in 1840. Farmer and justice of the peace in Trigg County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Died of cancer on August 29, 1852, in Trigg County.

ab.bibl:
Fifth Manuscript Census of the United States (1830), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 20.
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 290.

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 257.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994056, Trigg County Births/Marriages/Deaths, p. 3.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film # 000321335, p. 6.
